#stateof…

@EnvAgency Apparently Specialty Minerals Kings Norton have polluted the canal again and you are not acting as you claim that there are not enough reports.  What constitutes "enough"? @BrumGreenJulien (not your area but it spreads and you care) https://t.co/0UogamAGQc

One of the wetlands created last year in the Rea Brook as part of our REAction project in partnership @Reaseheath and @EnvAgencyMids 

This week there have been 60 snipe on the site

A great result! https://t.co/4WmBQOt7aX

@DartmoorRaven01 @WestcountryRT @EnvAgency @intlrivers The health of our rivers is dictated in part by the health of our catchments so our work looks across the whole area not just the rivers so floodplains, yes but also the rest of the catchment!
@BroadsBeat @NorfolkPolice @EnvAgencyAnglia @RuralCrimeNfk @AnglingTrust @CrimestoppersUK Only 3 !
@northyorkscc @EnvAgencyYNE Thank you for the info.

@nickw7coc @EnvAgencyYNE @nickw7coc Hi Nick Rivers are the responsibility of the Environment Agency, their contact number is 0800 807060, you can also contact Environmental Health at your local District or Borough council for advice. ^AA
@EnvAgencyAnglia Why is there any need for permitting catching a red list species at all.

text:
@saddleblaze @SpacePootler @RBourchier @MarcusxGrant @Photo_Iain @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @mariamartak @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @standardnews Tube, bus or cycle is ideal for some and certainly there are more folk who could utilise them however it'll always come down to whether people want to or not. 
No amount of stick versus carrot will get some folk to change because of practicality, comfort or necessity.
RT @EnvAgency: The coarse fish #CloseSeason starts today, meaning it’s illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15 June inclusive.…

@BierbergThomas They are on the migration path next tide should be plentiful @DefraGovUK @CITES @EnvAgency @EelGroup you still have a bit of time to save millions of these eels don’t turn a blind eye you have them on the critical endangered list https://t.co/zh0Mrj6VMv

text:
@SpacePootler @RBourchier @MarcusxGrant @Photo_Iain @saddleblaze @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @mariamartak @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @standardnews I can't imagine they've helped, hopefully things improve.
I'm still not a fan but always keep an open mind and happy to be proved wrong, seeing the chaos in other parts of London as a result makes me cynical but I guess ultimately, time will tell.

text: @acabbie @MarcusxGrant @Photo_Iain @saddleblaze @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @SpacePootler @mariamartak @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @standardnews My elderly in-laws live on Boston Road.  My wife & I used to invariably drive there.  Not now - 90%of trips are now by bike or on foot. The LTN works as it was designed to do! Those who can have need to cut the short journeys by car.

@GarethSimkins @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgencySE In my view councils are often the worst waste crime offenders. Dont know the rules. employ criminal contractors often with waste crime records. fly tip their own waste. Jusk ask the big consultants if the councils are compliant, they will run to the hills 😂

@GarethSimkins @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgencySE Ah the U1 exemption where do start. Ban it scrap it what use has it ever done? We are now the country of a million bunds (full of crap). Every waste criminal gets one of these and then states to his mates that ‘ive got a new tip boys’. Joke policy joke regulation .gov.uk
